title: Periodic Table of Typefaces
content:
Thought I'd share this link found via Mike Arauz and Twitter: Periodic Table of Typefaces. Kinda nice.

[http://i.friendfeed.com/b7b223a75a4e58aacc3f7704f1727a09637b15cf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150331013544/http:/i.friendfeed.com/b7b223a75a4e58aacc3f7704f1727a09637b15cf "http://i.friendfeed.com/b7b223a75a4e58aacc3f7704f1727a09637b15cf")
author: ihoff

comments.content: Is Cooper Black really Garalde style?
"Cooper" rhymes with "toupée" when it's pronounced correctly.
Thanks for pointing that out Cordoba. I just did a quick search for Periodic Table and came up with zilch.

_“'Cooper' rhymes with “toupée” when it’s pronounced correctly."_

Let go of my leg sir!

Seriously, if you're into type pronunciation, how do you pronounce "Frutiger"? I've heard...

Fruit a gher  
Fruit e zhay  
Fruit e jer
